senses.sense_definition: A player in football (soccer) whose main role is to attack and score goals, usually playing nearest to the opponent's goal.

examples.text: The team signed a talented new <w>striker</w> to help them win the championship.
Our main <w>striker</w> is injured, so we need someone else to lead the attack.

senses.sense_definition: A worker who refuses to work as part of an organized protest against an employer, usually to demand better pay or conditions.

examples.text: The <w>strikers</w> gathered outside the factory gates to demand fair wages.
Police were called to monitor the crowd as the <w>strikers</w> marched through the city.

senses.sense_definition: In cricket, the batsman who is currently facing the bowler and defending the wicket.

examples.text: The <w>striker</w> hit the ball powerfully toward the boundary line.
After a quick run, the <w>striker</w> returned to the crease just in time.

senses.sense_definition: A mechanical part in a firearm that hits the firing pin or primer to discharge the weapon.

examples.text: The gun failed to fire because the spring in the <w>striker</w> was broken.
He disassembled the pistol to clean the <w>striker</w> mechanism thoroughly.
Mr. <w>Striker</w> will be leading the meeting this afternoon.
I went to school with a girl named Sarah <w>Striker</w>.
